ygData.subject: Re: Financial Aid
ygData.msgSnippet: The first stone that yields magic results with silver is Jade.  You should NOT just start with jade.  The most cost effective way to build your skill is to go
ygData.messageBody:
The first stone that yields magic results with silver is Jade. You
should NOT just start with jade. The most cost effective way to build
your skill is to go from the cheapest stone up to the most expensive.
With jewlecraft you can increase your skill 2 points per stone before
being forced to move up to the next level. The reason it is most cost
effective to do it this way is that you are more likely to succeed,
which means you can sell the product back to the vendor for 5% loss or
less, depending on your Charisma. I don;t have the game open now
(obviously) so I can't tell you which stone to use at skill 25. You
can, however, count backwards because I do know the skill levels for
jade are 37 and 38, Amber is 35 and 36, Rose Quartz is 33 and 34,
carnelian 31-32, etc. Count down two points per stone to the level you
need to use.

Good luck!

And in case you care, I just got up to skill 36 but I failed my first
attempt at jade. Gotta collect 4 more PLat to try again!

Quentin on E'ci


--- "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...> wrote:
> From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
>
> it seems to me that the first magic rings you can
> make cost around 2 or 3
> plats to make.. but I suppose that you can sell them
> for more...with a base
> skill of 21, I dont want to waste money making
> non-magic rings. With which
> stone do you think I can start practice with? do I
> have to start from
> malachite? can I start with Onyx? or even more
> expensive stones? thanks for
> the help.
> Also, can you tell me which rings you found out are
> the best to sell to
> players?
> Thanks,
> Skara
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Eain Bankins [mailto:eain@...]
> Sent: Monday, April 26, 1999 2:24 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Financial Aid
>
>
> From: Eain Bankins <eain@...>
>
> Honestly, it's a great idea. Unfortunately, it
> takes SO much cash, that
> you'll have a problem convincing someone to do it.
>
> Here's what I do: Go wisp hunting. I have a necro
> that I team up with
> in the East and Wect commons. At 8th level (maybe
> 4th too, I'm not
> sure) Enchanter pets can hit magic. :) With two
> spellcasters, and two
> pets, as long as you can pull the wisps one at a
> time, you shouldn't
> have any problems. Also, pulling to a predesignated
> spot is great,
> because then as long as your partner can watch you
> incoming, he can tell
> you if there's anything else on you. Good incase
> you start a train,
> then you can zone right away. :)
>
> Bukaru, Teir'Dal Enchanter, Test Server.
>
>
